summary: This document is AT&T's response to a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on August 11, 2019. It includes a declaration and certification from AT&T custodian Daniel Dixon authenticating records for specified telephone numbers from July 6, 2019 onward, as part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal law.

persons.name: Daniel Dixon
persons.context: AT&T employee who certifies and authenticates records in response to the grand jury subpoena, declaring under penalty of perjury that the records are true duplicates and were made in the regular course of business.

persons.name: Nicolas Roos
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena dated August 11, 2019, requesting specified records from AT&T as part of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Listed as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York on the grand jury subpoena form.

connections.description: Dixon, as AT&T's custodian of records, responds to and certifies records in compliance with the grand jury subpoena issued by AUSA Roos.
Both are federal prosecutors with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York; Berman is the U.S. Attorney and Roos is an Assistant U.S. Attorney.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to AT&T
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to AT&T, requesting records for specified telephone numbers from July 6, 2019 onward.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena initially commanded AT&T to appear before the grand jury on this date, but compliance was allowed via record production.

events.title: AT&T Subpoena Response Delivered
events.description: Daniel Dixon executes the Declaration of Custodian of Records and Certificate of Authenticity, and AT&T delivers the responsive records to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: 11760 US HWY 1, SUITE 300, NORTH PALM BEACH, FL 33408 (AT&T Global Legal Demand Center address)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY (United States Courthouse for grand jury proceedings)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to AT&T on August 11, 2019, seeking extensive records for unspecified telephone numbers for the period from July 6, 2019 onward.

The subpoena is part of an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction, alteration, or falsification of records in federal investigations).
AT&T's custodian, Daniel Dixon, certified that the provided records are true duplicates made in the regular course of business, authenticating them under penalty of perjury.
The requested records include subscriber info, billing details, call logs, text message metadata, device identifiers, and account history for the specified numbers.
The document shows active federal investigation activities in the Southern District of New York in August 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
